result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Wayne Hill

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth Wayne Hill
Current: PO Box 1442, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: 117 E 5th St, Duluth, MN 55807 United States

11:17 AM Defendant Kenneth W Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Kenneth W Hill.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF83 and 22CF326. In 22CF326, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Parties ask that 22CF326 be set for trial and State notes that the other file if on appeal. State notes that the appeal is stayed because of appeal that was filed. Court would like statute number for staying the case of the appeal. State will find the statute and will send it to the court. State notes possibility of running into the same issue as the other case. State would be prepared for trial as early as December. Attorney Cockerham asks for date in 2023.
Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth W Hill
Current: 117 E 5th St, Duluth, MN 55807 United States  (Effective: 09-21-2022)
Prior: PO Box 1442, Superior, WI 54880

8:41 AM Defendant Kenneth W Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Kenneth W Hill.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Cockerham- Count was already charged out in 21CF83, same act. Wants to challenge complaint based on double jeopardy before prelim
State agrees count was charged on other case, double jeopardy doesn't kick in until he's convicted
State calls Christopher Woolery sworn and testifies- Deputy at DCSD. Did interviews with juvenile and defendant.  Defendant lowers mask. Witness identifies defendant. Also interviewed mother. Describes incident in Wisconsin. 
Att Cockerham no questions
Court questions witness
State-redirect
State rests
Att Cockerham- no witnesses
State moves for bind over
Att Cockerham- no comments
Court finds probable cause, binds defendant over
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State requests his physical address
Att Cockerham- client has been vandalized and threatened.
Court orders defendant to provide address
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: no contact with Victim, no intentional contact with minors under 18 with exception of may have contact with child of AL for health care purposes

1:57 PM Defendant Kenneth W Hill in court.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Kenneth W Hill.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court cals case.  Address verified. Middle name Wayne. Attorney acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading, request preliminary hearing.
State cites background information. Very serious case with possibility of life imprisonment. Defendant has made prior appearances in related matter. State relies on Court for bail decision. Conditions would include n0 contact with Victim, no contact with minors under 18 with exception of may have contact with child of AL for health care purposes. 
Attorney Cockerham argues this is same count as Count 1 in 21CF83 which was filed in february of 2021. Defendant has made all appearances in that file.  Parties were prepared to go to trial in that matter until it was continued. Argues that $20,000 already posted should carry over to this case as well as the signature bond. Likewise conditions should remain the same. 
Court orders 50,000 signature bond with conditions of  no contact with Victim, no intentional contact with minors under 18 with exception of may have contact with child of AL for health care purposes. 
Defendant waives time limits. Court accepts waiver as voluntarily and knowingly made.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
